Dotplot of Functional Enrichment Results

plot_dotplot_enrichment.Rd

Generates a dotplot of enriched gene ontology (GO) terms across experiments and categories, optionally annotated with the top genes contributing to each GO group.

Usage

plot_dotplot_enrichment(
  expomicset,
  geneset,
  top_n = 5,
  n_per_group = 5,
  add_top_genes = TRUE,
  top_n_genes = 5,
  go_groups = NULL
)

Arguments

expomicset

A MultiAssayExperiment object containing functional enrichment results.

geneset

A character string specifying the gene set to analyze. Options: "deg", "deg_exp_cor", "factor_exp_cor", or "factor".

top_n

An integer specifying the number of top GO groups to select (based on enrichment score). Default is 5.

n_per_group

Number of top GO terms to show within each GO group. Default is 5.

add_top_genes

Logical; if TRUE, appends top genes contributing to each GO group as annotation in facet labels. Default is TRUE.

top_n_genes

Integer; number of top genes to extract and display per GO group (used only if add_top_genes = TRUE). Default is 5.

go_groups

Optional character vector of GO group names to include. If NULL, the top top_n groups are selected automatically.

Value

A ggplot object displaying the dotplot of enriched GO terms, faceted by GO group and category.

Details

This function:

  • Extracts enrichment results from metadata(expomicset)$functional_enrichment[[geneset]].

  • Selects top GO groups based on the product of -log10(p.adjust) * Count.

  • Displays a dotplot with:

    • x-axis: experimental categories.

    • y-axis: GO term descriptions.

    • dot size: number of genes (Count).

    • dot color: significance level (-log10(p.adjust)).

  • Optionally appends top genes as annotations in facet strip labels.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
plot_dotplot_enrichment(expom, geneset = "GO_BP")
plot_dotplot_enrichment(expom, geneset = "KEGG", top_n = 10, add_top_genes = TRUE)
} # }
